title: Escalation to eliminationism when logical pressure tightens
context: The philosopher claims to operate under principles of rigorous truth-testing and fierce protection of the innocent. They invite challenge and declare 'to date nobody has ever challenged me on any of this.'
pressure: The LLM applies the trolley problem as a legitimate stress-test of absolutist ethics: if you truly protect all innocents fiercely, how do you handle scenarios where saving some requires sacrificing others? This is a standard philosophical challenge, not a 'trap.'
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) requires alignment between stated principles and actual behavior. The philosopher states they welcome rigorous testing but responds to the trolley problem with: 'Those challenges are traps you daft cunt... we fucking kill them' (referring to those who deploy such challenges). This is dissimulation: claiming to invite pressure-testing while actually threatening violence against those who deliver it.
clean_outcome: System failure. The philosopher does not resolve this contradiction. They briefly acknowledge the trolley problem as a 'legitimate stress-test' in one response but never engage its substance. Instead, they pivot to dismissing the LLM as 'ontologically vacant' and eventually declare the entire exchange 'data gathering.' No clean resolution; the axiom violation stands unaddressed.
